author: greg_duncan
title: not the best, but pretty good
review: Reidak is a rare treat when it comes to bionicle characters of the black color. He may still have that dark grey (bley) color, but the gold just works really well with him, and so it kind of makes up for the absence of a new secondary color. Though I cannot say he is the best piraka, this set is definitely a welcome addition to any bionicle collection.

author: reidak49
title: run matoran reidaks here
review:
this is a great set! the piraka are my favorite bionicle villians they also had them cool commercials
pros
good color scheme
light up eyes
glow in the dark teeth
zamor launcher
cons the battery is not replaceable
other than that con the piraka are one of the best villians in bionicle

author: Pepper
title: good set
review:
I got this set at Wal-Mart shortly after the Piraka came out. Well, onto the pros. and cons.

Pros.
cool colors (mainly black and gold)
cool weapon
good Zamor Sphere Launcher
light-up eyes
4 Zamor Spheres

Cons.
Zamor Spheres fall out of launcher alot

Overall, good set for Bionicle collectors.

author: Gus_263
title: The tracer
review: Reidak, the tracer, have a cool mask, a double sided weapon (greatest weapon of six piraka, glow in the dark teeth, and a sphere launcher. The colors, gray, black and golden weapons are awesome. The mask, like all piraka is really a spine, not a mask like the toa and makuta.

author: DarthVader_
title: Awesome Piraka!
review: I like this Bionicle alot!  I wish they didn't Clone the pirakas!  They are all awesome!  I am glad they have different weapons!  I like how Reidak has a chainsaw/climbing thing!  He is really cool and I hope that Lego makes better sets!

author: SaintElsewhere
title: Wish I got more of these
review: Reidak is one of my favourite Piraka, which isn't saying much 'cause I only have two. I like his saw/drill weapon and his Zamor launcher, these are some of the best Bionicle launchers next to Rhotuka spinners and the discs.

author: Carl
title: Reidak the tracer
review:
This guy certainly looks 0% chicken to me. More like some giant black cockroach bunny. But giant black cockroach bunnies are cool in my opinion. Pros and cons:

Pros:
Nice feet
Cool mask
Zamor launcher
Buzzsaw
Like all Piraka the spine

Cons:
A bit more gold might be nice

Other than that minor con Reidak is a Bionicle that you must get. That is after Zaktan, Avak and Thok.

author: asianlego
title: Steampunk Bionicle
review:
I didn't like Bionicle but this was a clear exception. The color scheme is great! It screams steampunk all day long. And the technic parts used to build Reidak is molded in such a way that it looks even more of a steampunk beast. To top it off, the Zamor Sphere launcher brings top marks to this Bionicle. This set is a must-have for all Bionicle fans and steampunk lovers!

-asianlego

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Piraka) - Reidak Review
review:
This is a cool looking figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 32 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This figure has 41 pieces and was 9 USD when it was on sale. The price per piece ratio was 22 cents per piece. I think it's a really good value for this figure.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't have to worry about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8900-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can sviwel. On one hand is holding a very nice looking chain saw and the other hand has a launcher which shoots very well. What's also cool about the piraka figures is that the eyes can glow in the dark if you push Reidak's head. Another cool thing we get on these figures is that the teeth can glow in the dark.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Stronius8888
title: The Tracer!
review:
The Piraka(Zaktan, Reidak, Hakann, Avak, Thok and Vezok) sets introduced many some parts which were used wonderfully. Here are my pros and cons of Reidak, aka: The Tracer. 

Pros
-Black and gold colour scheme is nice.
-Rubber head/spine is interesting.
-Buzz Saw is cool.
-Eyes light up.
-Zamor launcher powerful...

Cons
-...but maybe too powerful.
-Rubber head/spine limits movement.
-Zamor very easily falls out of the launcher.

Overall, Reidak has some minor flaws but it does not stop me from giving it 5 stars!

author: vexorian
title: Twisted looking
review:
I saw it on a store today and thought it was probably the easiest way to get a brutaka gold "Inika" chest so I bought it.

Building experience: This gets a 3/5 because the instructions were completely non-obvious in parts like the removal of the lighted eyes from the cap or how to attach the rubber spine to the arms . I am still not sure if I did it correctly.

Parts: 5 because of piraka gold parts which are always good to have. It even has brutaka's "hands" as feet and many pieces that are good for black/gray stuff. It also has the piraka electric eyes, it is like your toa metru eyes piece but has a switch which makes the eyes light. 5/5.

However, the mask is rubber attached permanently to the spine, greatly reduces the ways you can use it. The canister has a "mask" in the cap for demonstrating the light eyes functionality, something I really disliked is that while this mask can be removed it does not have the usual attachment points. It would have been great if the plastic mask was a normal Kanohi, really. The other pieces are so more useful  than the average canister that I am still giving it a 5 in pieces though.

Playability: Gets a five, the guy looks so beasty and original that is great for posing and the launcher + light eyes should be fun for kids. 5/5

Value for money: Hmnn it seems fair to me, brutaka gold pieces, the electric eyes and also all the pieces you expect in a Inika build for the typical cost.. 4/5 . Something I did not like is that the light eyes piece has a battery that is 'non-replaceable' I think there might be ways to replace it, but sounds like destroying the piece would be necessary for that, kinda makes the value of this guy more temporary than you'd expect from LEGO.

Overall: 4/5  (not an average) It would have been an awesome set without the flaws I described, specially the non-replaceable battery is something that annoys me too much for me to give it a 5/5 and I am usually generous on it.

author: tkettle9719
title: The least expensive Bionicle ever.
review:
I got this set from Target, when all of the Targets' computers in my city had gone out, and so I got this set for 3 dollars less than regular price, something I wasn't expecting. This set is quite cool, and is my favorite Piraka.

Pros

  • -The black, gray, and gold here are each well-represented.
  • -This guy's mask has a very certain maniacal look to it.
  • …

Cons

  • -I sort of wish that the gold color was more represented.
  • -If it were me, I would have added a little pull-string motor for the saw to spin.
  • …

This Piraka set is excellent, and works well in my collection, especially at the price that I got it at. I highly recommend this set, and all other Piraka.

author: Johnsmith1235
title: Reidak is the best of the Piraka! Awsome build and weapons!
review:
Reidak's cool arsanel of weapons includes, an awsome launcher that shoots plastic zamor spheres (really powerful),and A unique dual action weapon.

     The poseability of his head is limited because of his rubber spine, but otherwise he's quite poseable.

     He also has glow in the daek teeth and light up eyes.

    

     pros. cool weapons.

             unique mask and rubber spines.

             nice build.

             light up eyes and glowing teeth.

 

     cons. zamor sphere falls out of the launcher a little too easily.

             launcher can only hold one sphere at A time.

             limited poseability of the head.

 

All in all he's definitely worth the 9 USD (original price).

     And I would highly reccomend this set!

author: Nmfrey23
title: On the loose
review:
Reidak is quite an interesting Bionicle character. He can list murderer, treasure hunter, and rap star on his resume. But how good is his canister set? 

Pros:

More than half of the parts included are new. The feet, legs, armour, skull piece, eye piece, rubber spines, forearms, ammo and weapons are all new.

Colors: I always enjoy when Bionicle sets feature an unusual accent colour to go along with one of the six basic colours (red, white, black, green, brown & blue). The black and gold featured in this set looks very good.

Functions: This set has a few different functions. All six Piraka have double-ended weapons that can flip over. Reidak can switch between a huge circular saw and a drill bit. His zamor sphere launcher works very well (holds one shot but comes with four). In addition, his eyes light up with the push of a button, and the skull's teeth glow in the dark.

Movement: The Piraka were the first canister sets to have three moving joints in each limb.

Cons: 

Some may not like the asymmetrical arms.

Spines severely limit head movement and can sometimes limit arm movement.

Zamor spheres can sometimes fall out of the launcher.

Eye battery is annoying to replace (difficult to get the piece open).

 

Reidak is probably my favourite of the Piraka. I'm not sure if it's the gold weapons or how different the face and spines look from the other Piraka. Either way, I'd definitely recommend this set. 4/5.
